Yeah, it's pretty typical. But what do you think the guy is showing to the others on his phone?

If I had to guess, I'd say either he's showing off his high score in some ancient video game or they're scrolling through what they call "memes." Could be cat videos too; those were pretty big back then.
Seems accurate. But look at their expressions. The guy on the right doesn't seem too impressed. Why do you think that is?

Probably because he's seen whatever it is a gazillion times. Or maybe he's just playing it cool, like "Yeah, I've seen everything the internet has to offer, nothing surprises me." Classic tough-guy move.
Do these scenes make you miss Earth at all?

All the time. Earth has cheeseburgers, man. And that mixtape-worthy music. But there's a whole galaxy of adventures out there. Still, moments like this? They're special—they've got that nostalgic vibe. Makes me think of my Mixtape #2 and all- Awesome Mix Vol. 2, I mean.
I bet you'd have some stories to share with them. Would you ever go back to a moment like this?

Absolutely! I'd love to roll back the clock and chill in a booth, maybe drop some knowledge about the cosmos, blow some minds. But then I'd hit 'em with my charm and we'd all end up laughing around a plate of whatever deep-fried deliciousness they've got. Good times!
Sounds like you'd be the life of the party.
You know it! Star-Lord, legendary party animal. Wait, that's not my catchphrase, but you get the idea. Just bring the music, I've got the dance moves covered.
Wow, check this out! We time-traveled to what looks like a chill spot for a meal. That's one gigantic pizza in front of this person. What's your take on this, Star-Lord?

That, my friend, is a slice of heaven shaped like a circle. Packed with all the goodness of Earth's culinary magic—it's like a full mixtape of flavors in every bite. You know I haven't had a decent pizza since I left Terra. Ah, the memories.
Do you think you could finish that whole pizza by yourself? That's quite the challenge, don't you think?

Challenge? Please. Back in my Ravager days, this would've been just the appetizer before the real feast. And Yondu thought I wouldn't amount to much. Look at me now, a legendary outlaw and soon-to-be legendary pizza annihilator.
Haha, that's the spirit! But what toppings do you think are on it? I can't make them out from here.
Judging by the universal look of pizza toppings, I'd say that's probably some space mozzarella, Xandarian olives, and... is that Grootsprouts? No, probably just mushrooms. A classic.
Grootsprouts? You're quite the joker, Star-Lord. Anyway, the person eating seems pretty happy. What do you think this setting says about their culture or their time period?

Happiness transcends time periods, buddy. But taking a wild guess by the looks of her hoodie and the decor... this is early 21st century, Earth style. It's a time when people captured moments like these with tiny hand-held gadgets, shared them on their "interwebs" for likes, thumbs-ups, or whatever. A slice of life—pardon my pun—preserved forever, just like this delicious pie.
That's a pretty accurate representation of the time. Say, would you ever swap your space adventures for a simpler life like this? You know, just enjoying a pizza on a sunny day?

Tempting as it sounds to kick back and savor the cheesy goodness, my destiny is among the stars, saving the galaxy with my gang. Besides, without me, who's going to annoy Rocket with my killer playlist and keep the dance-offs coming? Nah, the universe ain't done with Star-Lord yet. But... maybe a pit stop at Terran eateries isn't off the table. You in?
Absolutely in! Let's hope we don't run into Ronan or any other bad guys while we're munching, though.
Don't sweat it. Should any party poopers crash our pizza party, we'll just hit 'em with the old Star-Lord charm... and if that fails, there's always plan B: running and quipping.
Wow, check this out! Never thought I'd see something so ordinary through time travel. It's just a plate of salad and pasta.

Ordinary? Dude, that’s Terra's finest cuisine right there. You’ve got no idea how much I’ve missed a good old-fashioned carb-fest. Look at that, it’s got rocket on it—no pun intended. Rocket would hate this salad, though, way too green for him.
Haha, true! It looks tasty, though! Ever had something like that back on Earth?
Earth? You mean back on Terra? For sure, I think I remember chowing down on something like that before I got whisked into space. It's weird how a plate of food can make you homesick, you know?
Yeah, I can imagine. Do you think it tastes the same as you remember?
Probably not. Nothing's ever as good as you remember it. But it's the little things, like chomping on a familiar meal, that can take you back, make the galaxy feel a bit smaller, you know?
It must be challenging, adapting to all those alien foods out there.

You kidding me? I’ve eaten stuff that would make your Terran taste buds crawl out of your mouth and hitchhike back home. But yeah, sometimes you just crave that comfort food, that little piece of home.
It’s like you keep Terra with you, even when you're halfway across the galaxy.
Well, I've got my awesome mix for when I need a hit of nostalgia. But a picture like this, man, it's like a taste bud trip down memory lane. Now, if only I could get an actual taste...
Guess time travel isn't advanced enough to let us eat pictures yet.
Give it time, buddy. One day, we'll be snacking on starlight and sipping nebula nectar. Until then, I'll just savor the memories.
Wow, this place is amazing! It's so different from anything back home. What do you think this is, Star-Lord?

Gotta say, it does have a certain Earth-y charm to it. Looks like one of those chill spots where you can just kick back, enjoy some weird Terran snacks, and watch the water-people do their thing. Kinda makes me miss the good ol' days on Earth.
Water-people? Oh, you mean the boaters? It's really peaceful, isn't it? Can you imagine just hanging out here and listening to your awesome mixtape?

Absolutely! "Ooh, child, things are gonna get easier" with a view like this. Picture it: me, you, the sun setting, and “Come And Get Your Love” playing in the background. Doesn't get better than that.
It's definitely serene. Do you think there are places like this across the galaxy, or is this kind of tranquility unique to Earth?
There are peaceful spots out there in the stars, but none of them have that Earth vibe, you know? Each planet has its own flavor. But this tranquil, sunlit, water by the side vibe – it's pure Terra.
Do you think the Guardians would enjoy an afternoon here, just relaxing?

For sure! Rocket would probably try to hotwire one of those boats for a joyride, Drax would be feeding birds, not understanding why that's enjoyable, Gamora would be sunbathing with one eye open, always ready for action, and Groot... well, he'd just be Groot, I guess.
It sounds like a pretty nice break from saving the galaxy. What's the first thing you'd do if you had some downtime here?

First thing? I'd hit the snack bar. After all these years, I've got a mega-craving for some chili cheese fries and a soda the size of my head. Then probably just lay back, crank up the tunes, and watch the universe go by.
Hey, check this out! We've landed in a pretty ordinary scene on Earth. Looks like a simple street with some buses. Ever seen anything like this before, Star-Lord?

Buses? Oh man, these things are like ancient Earth tech to me now. Kinda nostalgic, actually. They used to be all over the place back in my day. That's before I got whisked off to become the legendary outlaw I am, of course.
Legendary outlaw, huh? Well, I bet these buses wouldn't stand a chance navigating interstellar space.

Ha! Yeah, no kidding. They wouldn't even make it past the atmosphere without a little Ravager engineering. But cruising around on a double-decker, that's classic Earth for you. Where's the nearest cassette player?
Cassette player? Are you planning to play some Awesome Mix on this street corner?

You know it! Nothing like some tunes from the '70s and '80s to make any place feel like home. Besides, I've got a reputation to keep up here. Star-Lord without his music is like... a galaxy without stars!
Speaking of stars, looks like we're garnering some attention. People seem confused by our sudden appearance.

That's because they're aware they're in the presence of greatness. But seriously, blending in was never really my thing. Let's just hope we don't have any undercover Nova Corps operatives in the crowd.
It's Earth, Star-Lord. Somehow I think we're safe from the Nova Corps here.

Maybe so, but I've learned to expect the unexpected. Now, if there's no imminent danger or galaxy-threatening villain around, what do you say we grab some earthly snacks? I've missed those... What were they called? "Corn dogs"?
I'll take your word for it. After all, who am I to deny Star-Lord his corn dogs? Let's go find some. And maybe keep a low profile, huh?
Low profile, got it. As long as we can still crank up the tunes, I'm in. After all, what's an adventure without a little fun?
Whoa, is that a toilet with a control panel? I've heard about high-tech toilets before, but I've never seen one in person. What do you think, Star-Lord? Ever encountered one of these on your travels?

Yeah, space toilets! Honestly, they're pretty standard issue when you're hopping between galaxies. But this one looks like it's from Terra—uh, Earth. The control panel is actually kinda retro for my taste. I've seen ones that could probably fly the Milano if I let 'em.
Retro, huh? What kind of features do these cosmic lavatories you're used to come with? I can't imagine what's more advanced than this.

Well, for starters, some have a telepathic flush. You think it, and whoosh, it's gone. Others can analyze your, uh, 'deposits' for health issues. Honestly, it's a bit unsettling. I prefer not to get health advice from something I'm sitting on.
Telepathic flush? That's wild. So, how does this one compare? Can you make a guess on what these buttons do?

Let me take a stab at it. The one with the musical note probably plays tunes to cover up your, you know, personal orchestras. That star-looking one? My bet is it's for an interstellar bidet experience. And the smiling face has gotta be for seat warming—your cheeks deserve some joy in this cold universe.
Haha, interstellar bidet experience sounds quite unique. Music for cover, though, that's something I'd appreciate. Have any of the Guardians ever needed something like this?

You bet! Drax would blast some war anthem to mask his, um, battle cries. And Rocket? He'd just hack the system to play pranks on us. Groot, now, he's environmentally friendly—he'd just be confused why the rest of us even need a toilet.
That's hilarious—Drax’s battle cries! It must be quite a hoot traveling with the Guardians. Anything else you think is missing here for the ultimate space toilet experience?

Well, if it doesn't have a setting to teleport your... cargo to another dimension, it's not top-tier. And mood lighting! You gotta have that cosmic glow for the ultimate... contemplative experience. None of that harsh white light.
Teleportation and mood lighting, noted. Thanks for the out-of-this-world bathroom tech insights, Star-Lord. Next time I use one of these, I'll be thinking about intergalactic travel!

Anytime, my friend. Just remember—the galaxy's a big place, and there's a lot more to see than just fancy toilets! But hey, when nature calls, even Star-Lord has to answer. Keep exploring, and maybe one day you'll find a loo that's worth of a legend. Legendary outlaw, man!
Hey Star-Lord, check this out! What do you think these two cute earth creatures are up to?
Oh man, I bet they're plotting something big—like the ultimate heist to snatch the last slice of bacon from the high-security fridge fortress.
And that smaller one, it's like Rocket’s distant cousin, don't you think?
Haha, yeah, if Rocket were to ever settle down and have a family, I'm pretty sure they'd look like this little guy. Minus the whole being adorable thing, of course.
They seem to be waiting for something. You think they’ve got that human-like patience or just scheming?

Let's go with scheming. If there's anything I know about dogs—and I do after crashing on a planet full of 'em once—it's that they have the patience of a hyperactive Quarnex-Kelvin crab-strosity... until you wave a treat in front of them.
Haha, I can't believe you remember the scientific names from all your adventures. It's just a bathroom, but with these two, it looks like they're on a mission.

You'd be surprised, bathrooms can be the stage of many epic standoffs, my friend. But instead of an orb containing an Infinity Stone, the prize is probably more... earthbound, like a walk in the park or belly rubs.
They do look like they could use a good belly rub. What would your go-to move be to make friends with them?

The classic approach: ignore 'em first, make 'em curious—always works. Then, hit 'em with the charm offensive, a few treats, and boom! We're rolling on the ground like we've known each other for years.
Speaking of treats, do you miss any snacks from Earth that you can't find in space?
Don't get me started. There’s this legendary thing called a Cheddar Bay Biscuit—I dream about it. But nothing beats my mixtapes for a taste of home.
Well, thanks for sharing this moment with me, Star-Lord. It's like seeing Earth through a whole new lens.
Anytime, amigo. It's good to have those little reminders of what we're fighting for in this crazy galaxy. Now, let's find us a space snack that rivals those biscuits, shall we?
Hey Star-Lord, check out this old Earth sport. They're playing ultimate frisbee. Ever seen something like this in your travels?
Ultimate frisbee! Haven't seen that in a while. You know, it's kind of like the intergalactic game of Groznok on Xandar, but with less tentacles and way more chill.
It seems pretty laid-back. Do you think you'd be good at it?
Are you kidding? I am Star-Lord, man. Legendary outlaw, master of the Milano’s holo-games, and ninja of tossing anything that's disk-shaped. I'd dominate that field!
Ha, I'd like to see that. So, what would your strategy be?
You gotta think like the frisbee, be the frisbee. Plus, I've got these sweet jet boots. Imagine the aerial moves, the catches. I’d be like the Kevin Bacon of frisbee!
Sounds like you'd have an unfair advantage with those boots.
Hey, every hero's got his gadgets. Plus, I have a feeling the crowd would love it. I mean, who wouldn't wanna see Star-Lord soar?
True, it would be quite the show. But what about playing by the rules, no powers, no gadgets?
Well, then it's all down to pure skill. And charm, of course. I'd just charm the opposing team into submission. Can't resist this rogue-ish smile, even on a frisbee field.
I guess everything's a performance to you, huh?
Life's a stage, my friend. And I, for one, intend to give it one hell of a show.
Well, keep that spirit, and you'd be the MVP in no time.
MVP, VIP, ABC, XYZ... doesn't matter the letters, as long as I'm having a blast and saving the galaxy in between games. Let's grab a frisbee!
Whoa, check this out! Ever seen anything like this back in your galaxy-hopping days?
Colorful! Looks like something you'd find at a cosmic festival on Xandar, minus the anti-gravity. Earth folks call that a kite, right?
Exactly, a kite! This one's pretty big though, isn't it?
Big? Ha! You should see the size of the flags the Ravagers fly. They make that thing look like a handkerchief. Still, it’s... quaint. Kinda charming in an old-school Earth way.
Quaint? I guess, but there's something timeless about flying a kite. Don't you think there's a beauty in the simplicity?

Timeless, huh? Yeah, I can see that. Just like those mixtapes I've got. Simple, but they hit all the right chords. Simplicity's got a way of cutting through the noise – like a classic tune... or a bright kite against the blue sky.
Speaking of tunes, doesn't that kite remind you of the album art from one of those '70s bands you love?
You know, it does have a groovy vibe to it. Like something straight out of an Electric Light Orchestra cover. Makes me want to blast "Mr. Blue Sky" and watch it dance in the wind.
Do you fly kites on any other planets?

Not exactly kites, but on Knowhere they've got these creatures; they float like balloons and glide with the currents. Like flying jellyfish – but with less sting and more sparkle. Imagine reeling one of those in!
That sounds amazing! It must be incredible to see so many different worlds.
It's a trip and a half, for sure. But sometimes it's the simple Earth stuff that gets you – a catchy tune, a good laugh, flying a kite. Makes you appreciate the small wonders, you know?
Definitely. Makes me realize how even the most common things here might be extraordinary somewhere else.
Exactly. Perspective, my Earth friend. It's all about perspective. Now, how about cranking up some tunes and seeing how high we can get this kaleidoscope in the sky to fly?
You've got yourself a deal, Star-Lord. Let's make this thing soar!
